instruction: Analyze the historical performance of MSCI China A factor indexes and evaluate whether systematic strategies could have worked well with China A shares.
output: Our research indicates that many of the MSCI China A factor indexes, including minimum volatility, high dividend yield, value, quality, size, and momentum, have historically delivered higher returns than the China A market as a whole. Additionally, almost all of these indexes have delivered higher active returns in China A shares than in emerging and developed markets from November 2009 to March 2018. However, some MSCI China A factor indexes exhibited different behaviors before and after 2015, possibly due to the launch of the Shanghai-Hong Kong Connect program. Despite this, understanding the Chinese characteristics of various factors can be beneficial to investors as government policies and the market continue to evolve.
